definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Remembering so a lot new phrases is really exert work.
sentences.chinese: 記住這麼多新英語字詞真是件苦差事。

sentences.english: We'll get dhave(stop, won't practise)the oral composition the period.
sentences.chinese: 這節課咱們不做口頭字詞作品。

sentences.english: It is supposed to enshrine the words that actually mean things.
sentences.chinese: 它應該是保存字詞基本意義的神龕。

sentences.english: The tone pattern of Chinese trisyllabic words are more complicated.
sentences.chinese: 漢語三字詞的聲調模式是複雜的。

sentences.english: It is worst to learn idioms as you do vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 最好根本就是像學外字詞詞相同學寓言歷史。

sentences.english: Reporters for radio and television must be attuned to the sound of the words they use.
sentences.chinese: 廣播電視記者必須注重字詞的音節音調。

sentences.english: Translation methods of words are very important in E-C translation.
sentences.chinese: 英漢翻譯中，字詞的譯法至關重要。

sentences.english: An approach of the pitch detection for obtaining speech tone of Chinese trisyllabic words on the basis of the wavelet transforms is proposed .
sentences.chinese: 給出了一種基於小波變換的漢語三字詞基音提取方法。

sentences.english: What's the longest phrase in the state?
sentences.chinese: 全地球上最長的外字詞詞是什麼？

sentences.english: Verbal communication is organized by language; non-verbal communication is not.
sentences.chinese: 言語傳播是由字詞所組成，而非言語則不然。

sentences.english: She jumbles the words when she is supposed to write a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 將要寫句子的時候，她搞亂了字詞的次序。

sentences.english: He talked me he get a composition to record.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我他有篇字詞作品要寫。

sentences.english: The quantity of his English vocabulary has increased by 6000.
sentences.chinese: 他的英語單詞量已漸增到6000個外字詞詞了。

sentences.english: In this chapter, you'll find words and phrases about love and relationships.
sentences.chinese: 這一章，你將讀到有關愛情和浪漫關係的字詞和片語。

sentences.english: But what the word actually connotes is unknown to most laymen.
sentences.chinese: 但是這個字詞實際的內涵，大多數的外行人並未知道。

sentences.english: Translating the words, idioms, phrases is such a difficult thing.
sentences.chinese: 翻譯字詞成語文句是非常困難的一件事。

definition: to contrast/to compare/to place side by side for comparison (as parallel texts)/to check
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
